title: Emigre Magazine
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055625/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Publications](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055625/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Publications) : Emigre Magazine**

**Publishers:** [Emigre](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055625/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Emigre)/Princeton Architectural Press  
**Editor:** [Rudy Vanderlans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055625/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rudy%20Vanderlans)

_1984—2005_

Published by type foundry [Emigre](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055625/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Emigre) and Princeton Architectural Press, it was art directed and edited by [Rudy Vanderlans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055625/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rudy%20Vanderlans). The magazine moved to a music format in 2001 and was an outlet for the foundry to put their fonts to work in vital and interesting ways.

Back issues are highly collectable. They are in the permanent collections of the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum in New York and the Design Museum in London, among others.

After publishing the magazine for over 21 years it was announced that Issue No.69 would be the final issue. This milestone issue featured a behind-the-scenes look at its history, while contributors and colleagues bid the magazine farewell.

author: Conor
